question:
What is the output of the following code?
main() { int i = 1; i = i + 2 * i++; printf("%d", i); }

What is the output of the following code?
main() { #define scanf "%s is string" printf(scanf, scanf); }

What is the output of the following code snippet?
int a[3][4] = {{1, 2,}, {4, 8, 15}}; printf("%d", a[2][0]);

What will be the output of the following code if x=1234 is passed to the function display?
void display(int x) { if (x != 0) { display(x / 16); putchar("0123456789ABCDEF"[x % 16]); } }
What is the minimum number of times the do-while loop is executed?
Which expression yields the correct value for the expression 1/3?
What is the associativity of the ++ operator?
options: a for arithmetic expression and b for pointer expression
a for pointer expression and b for arithmetic expression

question:
What is the output of the following code?
int x=2, y=6; printf("%d", x=y);

What is the output of the following code?
int i = 0; while(i < 10) { if(i == 5) { continue; } printf("%d ", i); i++; }

What is the output of the following code?
int i = 0; switch(i) { case 0: i++; case 1: i++; case 2: i++; } printf("%d", i);

What is the output of the following code?
int ones, twos, threes, others; int c; ones = twos = threes = others = 0; while ((c = getchar()) != '\n') { switch(c) { case '1': ones++; case '2': twos++; case '3': threes++; default: others++; } } printf("%d", ones); If the input is 1alble, what is the output?

What is the output of the following code?
main() { int x = 5; int i = x++; printf("%d", i); }

What is the output of the following code?
int ch = 'A'; while (ch <= 'F') { switch(ch) { case 'A': case 'B': case 'C': case 'D': ch++; continue; case 'E': ch++; break; } putchar(ch); }
Identify the valid compound assignment operator.
The bitwise OR operator is used to

What is the output of the following code?
int i = 20; printf("%x", i);

What is the output of the following code?
int i; for(i=0; i<10; i++) { printf("%d", i); }

What is the output of the following code snippet?
main() { int ones, twos; ones = twos = 0; for (int i = 0; i < 20; i++) { switch (i % 5) { case 0: ones++; case 1: twos++; } } printf("%d, %d", ones, twos); }

What is the output of the following code?
int x = 5; x = x + 2 * x--; printf("%d", x);

What is the output of the following code?
int x = 5; printf("%d", x>>1);
